medical_history.chief_complaint: Massive sertraline overdose leading to confusion, agitation, myoclonus, hyperreflexia, fever, and creatine kinase elevation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was found in a somnolent state after taking approximately 8 g of sertraline and had been treated for acute alcohol intoxication 3 days prior to admission. Symptoms escalated over the hospital stay, particularly notable on hospital day 3 with acute mental status changes, agitation, disorientation, visual hallucinations, hypertension, and sustained clonus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of major depression and alcohol abuse with previous alcohol-related blackouts. Long history of psychiatric hospitalization after drug overdoses.
medical_history.social_history: Intermittent alcohol abuse; no detoxification history.
